articles.title: China consumer prices drop more than expected in September, staying in deflationary territory
articles.summary: Weak consumer demand has weighed on the world's second largest economy as a prolonged housing downturn continued hamper household spending and U.S. tariffs squeeze exports.

articles.title: China remains major growth area in Asia-Pacific region, JPMorgan executive says
articles.summary: China will become one of the "outsize contributors" to JPMorgan Asset Management's five-year plan to double Asia-Pacific assets under supervision to about US$600 billion, according to the firm's top executive in the region.

articles.title: Hong Kong's pension scheme earns higher grade, still lags behind Singapore's
articles.summary: Hong Kong's pension scheme improved its overall adequacy, sustainability and integrity over the past 12 months, rising from a C+ grade to a B - equal to schemes in some European countries but still trailing Singapore's - according to a report released on Wednesday.
